modName: Purity of True Storms - a compatibility patch
summary: A patch to ensure compatibility between "True Storms" and "Purity".
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]This is a patch to ensure compatibility and bring new supreme rainstorms of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63478/?]True Storms[/url] by fadingsignal into beautiful weathers of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65242/?]Purity[/url] by Laast.
Load this after Purity and True Storms, naturally.

Optional file in file section modifies the only weather not modified by "Purity" or "True Storms" to be in line with those.
[/size]
[u][b]
[size=3]
[/size]HYPOTHETICAL LOAD ORDER:[/b][/u]

[list]
[*][b][font=Courier New][size=3]Purity.esp[/size][/font][/b]
[*][font=Courier New][size=2]--some-skimpy-clothes-mod-that-JUST-HAS-to-be-after-Purity-but-before-TrueStorms--[/size][/font]
[*][b][font=Courier New][size=3]TrueStorms.esp[/size][/font][/b]
[*][b][font=Courier New][size=3]TrueStorms-Purity.esp[/size][/font][/b]
[*][size=3][font=Courier New][size=2]--the-rest-of-your-endless-load-order[/size][/font]--[/size]
[/list]
     [size=2]...or, maybe you could try [url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url]. Just saying..[/size]






[u]
[/u][b][u]CHANGELOG:
[/u]
[/b][list]
[*][b]29.05.2015      Created and added an optional file, answering concerns about one weather type looking too bright. Turns out, this weather wasn't covered by either of mods. So, I decided to right all wrongs and straighten all bends.[/b]

[/list]











[size=2][size=1]H[/size][/size]U[size=3]G[/size][size=4]E[/size] [size=5]THANK YOU[/size] [size=3]to both [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2546964/?]fadingsignal[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1213768/?]Laast[/url] for making Skyrim unbelievably gorgeous.[/size]
author: mctag
